Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne asada
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La ensalada de cobb

meUaOBaygJnYMRXcgIjunw.text: Great food.  Great service.  Great churros. My husband really enjoyed the braised beef.  We both commented on the cool atmosphere.  Would return next time we are in Phoenix.

MTuCjX-QJoGq53Nzb_T8GQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked for quite some time. I love myself some great tacos and great margs and always looking to try out somewhere new. Ladara did not disappoint!  My date got the el santo, which was incredible. I opted for the house marg with the added paleta, which was a nice treat on hot Phoenix evening.  We both got the carne asada tacos which were full of flavor!  Only wish is that they came with guac, but will make sure to order that as an app next time.  Awesome dinner, we'll be back!

ucDL_WGKSYNhMaAGJpVsQA.text: Wow - we had a great time, great service and great food. Our waitperson, Carline was very friendly and helpful, making recommendations that we really loved.   We started out with a pair of Paloma cocktails that tasted very refreshing in the hot summer weather. While sipping our cocktails, we munched on the outstanding guacamole with pumpkin seeds and oranges that was super creamy and delicious.   For our entree, my wife had a good shrimp burro (aka burrito) and I had a marvelous chili relleno with barbacoa on the side. The relleno was different (and better from my perspective) from most rellenos. It wasn't battered and deep fried, it was char grilled only. The STAR of the show was the barbacoa. It was tender, spicy and very flavorful and layered. Best barbacoa I've ever had. I Highly recommend it.  Can't wait to go back.

Qr8yvKWbFdA5v3VUOFo5MA.text: Live this hidden gem. Cozy beautiful patio  live music on Thursday night and for Sunday brunch. The food and drinks are delicious

ZYhGdflK90DXMWJY5tzrFw.text: We came here for the patio and happy hour and it was perfect! Robert was our server and he was awesome! Great server that knew how to read a table and suggest appropriately. We will be back for sure! If you like Paloma's, there's is amazing!

goY-rYDkTIe43o3hqib6Mw.text: Hours stated open until 11.  Walked in at 9:45 and while the hostess was pleasant, the bartender came rushing out to inform us that the hours listed had changed, they were closing soon, and we would need to place our order within 5 minutes. He apologized the owner hadn't updated the hours (wait... Phoenix, October, busy season approaching and you are closing earlier on weekends?)  It was a busy Friday evening, and coming from a service industry background...it's obvious when the staff is more interested in closing than serving and keeping clientele. Side note--we tried a couple times to call prior to arriving, to inquire about reservations and such - but never had anyone answer the phone.  After my two dinner companions had already walked out the door, not appreciating the rude behavior, the hostess was apologetic and understanding, even trying to reassure we could order food, while the bartender had already retreated back to his side work. Menu looked interesting, unfortunately the "manager/bartender" killed any chance of my business or referal.

2SnKOht6y4kMxl2tf4r4iA.text: I wish my group could have gotten a 5-star experience! Let's see what happened that made these stars drop off...  1. We had to constantly ask for water; at one point we pulled over a different server and asked him to bring us a pitcher 2. I unfortunately had an allergic reaction to a cocktail (although I must say - it was delicious!) and after 2 sips, sent it back, and switched to a simple beer. When the bill came the cocktail was still included. If I was going to be charged for it, I would have given it to someone else sitting at my table. 3. The table split the bill, but 1 person got charged an extra $21.00. The problem was solved quickly when pointed out, but if the server was initially confused she should have verified with us. 4. 1 person had a plate full of leftovers, and when the server came to clear it she asked if she could have a box. The server offered to box it for her. My friend said "are you sure? you have a lot of plates..." but was reassured it wasn't a big deal. The box was never brought out, and we found out the food was thrown away.  5. We got the free churros with the yelp check-in and when they finally came out my friend picked one up and burnt her finger so bad it left a blister. I wish they would've given a heads up that they were scalding hot. Maybe if the table had water she could have cooled off her skin quickly....:)  All the events individually weren't a big deal, but when it all happens during your first impression it certainly taints the experience (especially when it's your birthday...). Overall, everyone enjoyed their food...when fingers weren't being burned or food wasn't been thrown away. The patio atmosphere is quaint and relaxing. You have to park in a dirt lot, but it's better than driving around the neighborhood looking for a spot! I'm sure the experience was a fluke, maybe we'll come back after the blister heals.

ICXSNXKhUXsue9RcQub7VA.text: So good!  We had the guacamole and the queso for starters, some of the best guacamole we have had. The cocktails were also great, and the chili relleno and Baja enchiladas were delicious. Oh, and the street corn side! Absolutely recommend.

mj_eLa3RzAa-NepScDqVJg.text: Great food, drinks and atmosphere.  A must try place.  The ceviche is delicious, I crave it.   Brunch is tasty and the sangria is perfect!

a6s9l9_oe5Z4mCpaE4bYKA.text: Best Mexican brunch I have ever had!! Gorgeous patio ambience, fire place, bistro lights, corn hole, and seating! The food is delicious with great flavor. Brunch is on point with $4 mimosas, bloody marry, sangria and even Micheladas! Can't beat the price and amazing service! I will be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some of the best Mexican brunch I have ever had! Amazing service and food!

WjGx19OOspxWmJAbHSpDsw.text: Such a beautiful place to enjoy great food and amazing drinks. The mezcal selection here is one of best in city- their bar manager Colton has to be one of the smartest people in Arizona when it comes to agave. He has a passion that comes across as he gives you his stories of travels down in Oaxaca. Take a journey on one of the mezcal flights he suggest. Saludos!!

QW1ll-IlquJl6ES-7onnAQ.text: I'm honestly very confused by the Arizona Republic on their review regarding this new Genuine Concepts restaurant, I've only had good experiences here. I've been here quite a few times since they opened and have tried a lot of what's on their menu, their food is amazing. Despite living in Arizona for 18 years, this is one of the only restaurants I've been to that serves authentic Mexican food that I truly enjoy. The tacos (especially the pollo and carne) are outstanding, never too heavy and always meet my expectations. The pollo entree is out of this world, chicken is extremely tender, perfectly seasoned and comes with side of fresh made tortillas.. YUM!! The nachos are huge.. literally a pile of tortilla chips, meat, cheese, guac and so much other yummy goodness on one plate, would definitely recommend ordering this when with a big group because it could easily feed 10 people as an appetizer. The quesadilla, although may sound pretty basic and standard was seriously one of the best I've ever had and you wanna know why... cause it's fried and topped with salsa and guac! Now to the desserts... I've tried all 3... multiple times. The fried banana being my favorite, it's amazing, comes with side of ice cream and the mix of the 2 is simple and tastes amazing. The fried ice cream and churro are also 2 desserts I recommend, so yummy! The ambiance of the restaurant was very cool, lots of seating indoor and outdoor. Friendly staff, amazing food, and a beautiful restaurant.

KQvQADWqcPBT0XltfN8jhg.text: I agree with everyone about the ambience- very well done, welcoming and patio is beautiful!  Servers were friendly. Took a long time for drinks. I ordered a frozen margarita- was surprised to find out that the frozen margarita was bartender's choice, which tonight was a smoky mango? Not for me but the waitress happily took it back. Thick tortilla chips. Salsa trio was good.   I do agree with previous review about tortillas, definitely the thick corn tortillas you buy in a grocery store. I had heard portions were small for the price. Guacamole was very tasty but I do have an objection to paying $10 for what appears to be less than one cup. My partner had the chile relleno which he liked, I had the Tijuana Caesar, which was good, although it said it was to be dressed with jalapeno ranch, but I received a vinaigrette. Definitely would skip the pork verde as it was watery, bland and had very few chunks of pork in it.  The eggs, both on my salad and pork verde were undercooked and still jelly like.  A lot of these things are new restaurants jitters, which may resolve in time, except for the portion size, which I expected having heard from 3 different couples, but still not a good starting rep.

rhvqlECXS48kVauNKi_R2w.text: Went here last night.  Love the lighting and the whole vibe.  Very large and beautiful patio.  The service, at the outset, however, was poor.  We sat for at least 10  minutes without anyone approaching our table, and only when I stood up to leave did a server appear.  After that, however, all was well and the service was attentive.  We ordered the salsa trio to start and all of the salsas were very flavorful and fresh tasting.  I ordered the shrimp and blood orange salad.  The shrimp was very tasty, but the underlying greens were overdressed, and marcona almonds were chopped too fine to be tasted, and the fried pieces of cotifja cheese were too salty to eat.  Overall, not a great dish.  My husband ordered their version of a cobb salad and it looked great!  Lots of chicken and veggies.  He loved it.  We will return to this neighborhood place, perhaps for happy hour and to try the tacos.....

VvMChSqPL6MNN0mxFZVrLA.text: Best carne asada and street corn I've had! We've been here a few times and never they never disappoint!

bx5qgQTvkC68GpgGJJnTGw.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. DO NOT go here if you have ANY food allergies because they are very bad at catering to your needs. I ordered the guacamole dairy free and it was brought out with cheese on it and when we told them, the guy took it back and just PICKED off the cheese. The waitress was also very rude and very unwilling to work with us to get gluten free and dairy free food.  This picture is the guacamole that was brought back after "remaking" it... but there is still cheese on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sjwb2o6LVGgWZ6h1oJc-bQ.text: Had dinner last night with some International delegates from Korea we all just loved menu, the service was outstanding and the vibe was amazing. We started with the quesadilla barbacoa, we also enjoy the elote, and calabacitas. Our main dishes were the chicken mole enchiladas, and 5 taco plate,  all amazing.  Reset inside but the outdoor patio looks enchanting I'll have to try that next time

YjQNR1OKFxlpHbZ3ZvT8FA.text: Waited a solid 5-10 minutes while the bartender chatted with guests 3 seats over. Was never acknowledged and after spending the last 3 minutes swinging my head around looking for ANYONE to serve me I decided to leave without ordering. I guess they're doing so well they dont need anymore business?

Cv7KDhfdSvDeaS9uSqb50Q.text: Yes, yes and yes! Drinks, food and ambiance were all on point. We sat on the beautiful patio. Plenty of seating options etc. high tops, lounge seating. I would recommend Ladera as a gathering place for meeting up with a group of friends or a date night. Great service! Two thumbs way up!

C2eN2YXsa28_Z36lzCB8Pg.text: Would rate this gorgeous, delicious, restaurant higher if they had a changing table in the men's room. It's 2019 people, we need changing tables in all restrooms.   Other than this deliberate oversight we loved this place.  Their patio is GORGEOUS, spacious, cool, shaded, and stylish. The drinks were great, can you sat $4 margs, mimosas, and bloody Mary'??!?!?!   Hope to return again to see one small change and to enjoy the rest.

j_4ngKnhMHwd7h19q19bGg.text: After having this place bookmarked for a while and repeated recommendations from my roommate, we finally when to Ladera the other night and I'm so glad we did :) their patio is so cute and pretty and the food is delicious! The atmosphere was perfect for a warm and sunny weekend night.   We made it in time for happy hour, and they have really great deals so we took advantage and just ordered off that menu. First, my boyfriend had the house margarita and I had the Pinche Paloma. He really enjoyed his and said it was pretty strong. Mine didn't seem to have much tequila in it and was a little more carbonated than I like, but still good.   For an appetizer, we had the guacamole with chips, and it was super tasty. They put a lot of cheese and pepitas in it which I really liked, and they give you a good amount with tons of chips (and free refills), which was nice because a lot of places can be kinda stingy on that lol.   Then, for dinner we split the pastor and carne asada tacos. This was one of those places where once I was eating them, I was like, omg this is why I love tacos so much - they were amazing! It was hard to decide, but I think the pastor were my fave - I loved the pineapple pieces on top.    Then, for dessert, we had the churros (you get a free order when you check in!), which have a salted caramel in the middle and come with a chocolate/whip cream sauce. Those were excellent as well :) I would definitely recommend this place if you're into tacos, and I know we will be back soon!

Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastor tacos

o1-D3O_RNXvhkWgG49D2VQ.text: Went today for Sunday brunch on the patio. Had the whole package going on. Music was live and pleasant, food was very good, drinks reasonable price and patio was beautiful. Service was very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio

eKaNkXFGVWgIEsFSS8G7tg.text: I love ladera! Pretty pretty spot! I always sit outside here! Their sangria is great! I love when they have live music too!! The entire outside ambiance is fantastic and I'm always really happy with the people working too!  It can get really busy, but if there's a wait, grab a drink at the bar!:)

UwhLmWB5HahNqKn0d1QPcQ.text: I appreciate management reaching out to rectify the situation.  I really like the food here that was the only thing that really bothered us about the experience.   Food was great, love the barbacoa plate.  However very displeased when we got our bill and they decided to charge us $3 per fountain soda refill without telling us and there is no reference to it on the menu.  Never ever heard of that logic.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio area great ambiance. Perfect for a date night.

SCZFH7UAgW9aIAl7nBQiQA.text: Met a client here for dinner.  It's part of the Genuine Concepts family of restaurants, and since I like The Vig and other places of theirs, I thought I'd check out Ladera.   Plus, it was in her hood.  We sat outside, which it was a windy day that day.  I had the manhattan, which I gather was with house whiskey.  Dunno.  UGHHH!!  So I asked for a manhattan with Bulleit Bourbon.   She had a happy hour margarita.  UGHHH!   She didn't like it either.   I told her to send it back but she didn't.  She did ask for them to put in more of whatever they sweeten it with.  When she got it back, she said it was better but she still didn't really like it.  I ordered the COCHINITA PIBIL from the menu, but I noticed on the bill it said puerco pibil.  I don't know if that's the same thing.  She ordered the happy hour pollo tacos and a quesadilla.  Mine came with a side of black beans and I asked for flour tortillas versus the corn.  The food was bland.   It needed some sort of kick.  She said her tacos lacked umff as well.  I told her maybe it needed salsa -- or something!   She asked Sarah, our server, for salsa.   She said it helped a little.   I was thinking that's what I should have had as well.  I took most of my meat dish home.  Since I have salsa, I added some of that to it.   It seemed to give it a little boost.  I think they are trying to be a Richardson's, which I do like the flavoring of their foods.   It just lacked flavor -- or something.  Sarah was pleasant and professional.   I think this is one of the Genuine Concept restaurants I won't be visiting again.

_eQl4MzQEq2lvYo2GzzHtQ.text: Delishhhh tacos. I was able to mix all 3: shrimp, fried fish and grilled fish! I was very impressed with the flavors and texture.  The atmosphere rocks for networking and even date night. We had cocktails at the tall tables on the patio.   Meanwhile, the bartender Carolina was attentive and full of flair. She was an expert on the menus and directed my food and drink choices perfectly. Her convo skills are warm and upbeat. Gave her a fat tip!

BTVIOuAruG25kEm1nyA0fw.text: We ate here last night and we're extremely disappointed. The chicken, shrimp, and fish for the tacos were really poor quality. The service was slow. The margaritas were so-so. Such a bummer. We wanted to love it but we will not go back again.

CQ_YUboA72oNkG1pcvgBSw.text: 4.5 stars  Great abiance, food, and drinks.   The Pastor Burro was huge and very flavorful; definitely one of the better pastor burros I've had. The guacamole appetizer (w/ salsa) was great, and the Barbacoa was pretty good too but the beef was a little bland.   The El Santo is one of the more popular cocktails here, and its awesome.

Smg1gFi72orfZQdrdi5cjQ.text: Probably going to be one of my new brunch spots when I am in town.  The restaurant is nice, but the patio is beautiful.  I imagine once the weather cools down it will be packed!    I was attracted by the brunch drink specials that they have.  I was looking for something other than bottomless mimosas and found it.  They offer $4 margaritas, mimosas, sangrias, bloody maries and micheladas.  They had a blended sangria that day that was delicious!  I hope they keep it on the menu. My favorite was the margarita, though.    We ordered the El Americano, the Steak Ranchero and the Barbacoa Hash. All good.  I look forward to trying more of their dishes.  The service was top notch!  Service with a smile!

kCEpfkmo3685YMXGqrW_tQ.text: Loved it so much, we came back for more!  The Mexican Tempranillo was a great start.  The ceviche was even better then the first.  The crispy Red Snapper was AMAZING!  Full of flavor.  Prepared with roasted vegetables and fruits.    Overall an outstanding.  Ladera is one of the absolute best restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale metro area and an excellent reason to visit the Central Phoenix/Sunnyslope area.

sCl6D9Js5u_l4YOEBh3sOg.text: I really loved the atmosphere and the service was nice. I ordered the Sopes because they said it could be made vegan. Now the reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the chef made it with cheese. The server apologized and said the chef didn't know what vegan was. They remade it and the assistant manager spoke with me that they were going to speak with the chef. I do hope that they have spoken with the chef because every chef should know what vegan is because someone could get seriously ill if they eat dairy or meat. I haven't ate it in years and it has turned into an allergy now where I would become ill if I ate either.

glDwsDMPFHQPXWYXer_xag.text: We were here for brunch and the service is great.  I love the music selection.  There patio is excellent and inviting.  It's about 104 degrees in Phoenix  and we were able to sit outside. Great happy hour prices. I was shocked that it wasn't busier.  We ordered the mole enchiladas and they were delicious, however I would have liked them a little hotter in temperature.  That is the only recommendation I have but even then 5 stars.

aJVq59uugru2LASNEDIjBg.text: Overall food was delicious and staff was super friendly and thorough. Bartender was our waiter so he got tied up a lot and couldn't be attentive to our table because he had many bar customers (completely understandable and not his fault), but the GM came and made sure we were take care of while he was busy. She was a sweetheart. Great people at Ladera!

APyeIhAGfNFbrpgp24EoRA.text: Katrina was an amazing sever. Amazing ambiance, food, and service. 10/10 can't wait to come back

xSqZ8m4I669AxnVt3bw-jw.text: Found this spot on a trip to AZ in the middle of a neighborhood. It was like an oasis with really trendy decor and good food. We had the tacos and carnitas which were tasty and hot the spot. Live acoustic guitar and singer was a nice touch on a Thursday night.

gVpC9OMjTuGaOvQDNmia3w.text: Food was amazing! Super cute place with great outdoor seating... The shaved corn as a side is the best corn I've ever had. Yum! They also have live music on certain days with is so fun.

_3AIrwmQaW214-OWqYRaPw.text: Wow. Just WOW! We had delivery thru uber, so it was a little cold, but it didn't even matter- this food is incredible. We ordered off the brunch menu and shared the mole enchiladas, French toast, chicken enchiladas, guacamole, and Barbacoa quesadilla. Everybody couldn't say enough positive things about the food. The salsa is chunky and the freshest I've had in recent memory. The chicken enchiladas were cheesy but also hearty with savory, simmered chicken. The French toast was unique and unlike anything else in town (but make sure you're a coconut fan). It's clear they put time and skill into these dishes. I'm so thankful this place is in our neighborhood---we will be back!!!! And now, I'm going to go enjoy this Saturday food coma. :)

u05kpZN0EXwyafr3HhpnAQ.text: They nailed it from all aspects!!  Incredible ambience, we sat outside in June and the misters made it comfortable.  Tasty margarita and the tacos were outstanding!  Calabacitas (vegetarian) were yummy!  And the churros were so yummmy.  Coming back soon - you should too!

w2kY688m1P2Q0dUE038iYg.text: This Modern Mexican Restaurant is as good as you'll find in Phoenix, Scottsdale or Arizona for that matter.  The restaurant can offer just about everything...  Reasonable prices, great appetizers and drinks, great good, amazing ambiance and excellent service.  Go here!

PV7JZUtX5OnUBrlrVgsxBA.text: 5 stars!!! It was delicious! I had brunch here today. Love the ambiance. Our server was Tony who was friendly and attentive. One of the chefs came to our table and checked on us. Customer service was great! Now for the food, I had chilaquiles and French toast( I was starving ). Loved my orders. Food is authentic, the only I didn't like were the black beans with my meal-everyone else loved it though. My sister had the barbacoa and my bf had a burrito. Everyone was beyond satisfied. Our bill was cheap. I'm coming back next week for brunch.

P12LQx4Pqab04Dy2RFky8A.text: This place was absolutely awesome. We had a group of 20 that we needed to get in ASAP and they were super accommodating. The 5 taco platter  was awesome. Good sampling of all the tacos. The salsa and guacamole were also super good.  We sat inside but the patio looked beautiful. Lot of space, definitely good for groups. They also had live music that was really nice to listen to. I would definitely come back here and recommend this place.  The churros were amazing as well. Super fresh and soft. And the cream that came with is was whipped cream and caramel. Fantastic overall

ETuyUBug-9n_oxOxmykqIw.text: YELPERS BEWARE: FALSE ADVERTISING!!! Ladera promises free churros with check in and then charges you $3 for them. The coupon literally says "free churros with check in" and then it shows up as $3 on your check. When we asked why we were charged, our waitress said that she checked with her manager and it was their policy. Ladera, why even have this coupon available if you are not going to honor it?

jndMiMLZb_h04zHpHw-bZw.text: Just great!! Great happy hour prices, great food. The scene can be a bit crowded at the bar..but not so much where you want to push people out of the way. The outside area is a cool weather only option..I went when the sprinklers were down in July and you can pretty much kiss any outside enjoyment goodbye.   This is defiantly a place in my rotation and should be considered a place to bring new folks, or folks in a group setting.   I attended an event there and it went off rather swimmingly.

ZGlf1-3jQdrLMJ-eSY9gNA.text: Oh My Gosh - Did I forget to review this place?? Shoot. Met some friends for HH and dinner a few weeks back. Service was efficient and helpful, and the outdoor patio was divine. Of course this was in April.... But, the chips and salsa/guacamole were some of the best ever. I liked them even more than some of the popular combos around town. We all ordered a variety of different tacos and the chicken mole. Tacos were all good, every last one of them. But that mole! Loaded with sweet, nutty, spicy flavors all over a gi-normous half-chicken. Leftovers!!! Really delicious stuff and fresh yummy tortillas too. We skipped dessert but maybe next time. Oh, yes. There will be a next time.

jPinuxkQAzYEtjHQ7E6m6A.text: Really great food and service! They have a very nontraditional menu, but all of it was too notch! I wouldn't head here if you're looking for a standard burrito or tacos, but this is a great location for casual-fancy brunch or date night!

xsmnodz5Kqoj5-1rD1uYzQ.text: Cool building,love the patio! Great cocktails fantastic food!  Customer service is great!

Yab-prJev06q08Kmbs_NvQ.text: Ladera is by far the best Mexican food since we arrived in Phoenix!  The service with Tony was ridiculous good and even the GM Dijon came and checked in on us!  If you are looking for a great restaurant with an unbelievable atmosphere come here!

It was some sort of queso dip that had all sorts of "stuff" in it and it hardened quickly.   It would also be nice if the taco size grew over time and the soda and draft beer wasn't flat.  Improve each day!!!

lq0mXo9eLAZWL-KW8H7Ipw.text: Exellent food and friendly atmosphere. The guacamole is outstanding and the micheladas refreshing. Good for families and and a fun bar. Highly recommended.

n737TIG3vJ8AZTCZDAomng.text: my husband wanted to take his mom out fo brunch on her birthday so we stumbled upon this place. At 1st I felt uneas

_rRCtiEdZgaezywxyyD6Hw.text: Absolutely loved this place!  The food,  the atmosphere,  oh and the service! Fabulous! My friend and I went for happy hour.  The $5 cocktails were so refreshing. I had the El Santo, like a margarita with whiskey. So good! And we ordered the carne asada tacos with a side of elotes,  seasoned corn. It was all delicious! The carne asada had great flavor with caramelized onion,  and was served on handmade corn tortillas. Also,  we had the churros for dessert.  They are filled with this amazing caramel sauce,  and served with an incredible tasting chocolate sauce and bits of pomegranate. Just wow!  Our server was Tony.  He was so attentive,  personable,  and took time to answer our 20 questions about the cocktails and food. The best service I have had in ages! I will definitely be back soon! Ladera is my new favorite restaurant!

sgC7M0jkHFTox2l3PgpOqA.text: This is such a great Mexican food restaurant, love everything on the menu! The bloody Mary's are amazing! The service is great! The atmosphere of the patio area is great for outdoor dining specially on a hot Arizona afternoon. Love the music that they play over the speakers. Parking is easy to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles

XL8ctQbNCYZeqb_430OmAA.text: My mom was in town and wanted a good place to eat with Mexican food. All of our norm spots had wait times and didn't want to wait with two little ones so a friend recommended this place and we went. We started off with the Sangria Tinta and guac! Really tasty with a hint of citrus flavor and the salsa had a real KICK to it. My hubby ordered 1/2 chicken and my mom and I ordered the pollo Asada burros but with shrimp. My mom loved hers...me not so much. The crema wasn't my cup of tea. The kids ordered chicken and rice and quesadillas. Our waitress Tera was the BEST! Very down to earth and great energy! Please ask for her. Oh a got the churros for dessert...another winner. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uy130FLp_AxB0E0kRCVvFQ.text: This is one of our new faves. We've been twice now and the food and service are consistently great. Last night, our server Matt, just completely made the entire experience - he was so genuinely happy and helpful, we loved him. Also, have the beans and street corn, I would eat these as a meal alone they're so good, plus the bar actually knows how to make an Old Fashioned. So much yes.

y29gA0bDiJuKI9zxCOhhcA.text: This restaurant is beautiful. Went on a Sat evening and the outdoor area is gorgeous. Drinks are excellent and very well priced. Our server was so nice - Adrianna i think her name was. She was very helpful with recommendations from the menu. She was right the gucamole was amazing! I normally dont get guac from restaurants but its good. So good i caught myself thinking about it the other day at work. The tacos were delicious- the shrimp and carne asada were my favs. There was a singer outside  ( may 5th) and he did an amazing job.  I am a sucker for live music.  Overall this place is 5 stars- they have a parking  lot, great service, great food, drinks are not pricey, beautiful design and decor.

xOXg3AxuRYRJLSI0g66rFA.text: From the moment we stepped foot at Ladera, we were in love. The place is gorgeous. We sat outside on a hot summer night, and we were comfortable and amazed by the beautiful decor.  For starters, I ordered the elote. You can never go wrong with elote. It wasn't too heavy on the sauce and cheese like some elotes which I loved. We had the guacamole which was just okay - a little bland for my taste but still worth getting. For my main dish, I had the cochinita pibil which I loved. It came in a mountain of pork deliciousness, warm tortillas and the best black beans ever. It was a huge dish. It tasted just as good the next day. My boyfriend ordered the chiles rellenos which he really enjoyed. For a vegetarian dish, it was amazing. I tried one of their carne asada tacos which I thought was just okay - it was a little dry so I think I would definitely stick with their main dishes next time. I had their delicious margaritas too.  We loved this place so much that we came back a few days later for brunch. Definitely get the chilaquiles and the barbacoa hash. They are both amazing dishes. My sister ordered the french toast. It is not your typical french toast. It had coconut which I am not a fan of but I was surprised at how delicious it was. My sister's boyfriend ordered the burrito which he loved as well.   If I could give half stars, I would definitely gives this place 4.5. The service was great. Everyone was wonderful and attentive despite the busyness. The prices are great and worth it. We will definitely be back!

8Y1LWhNGC89xzItFUjRG_Q.text: Hip hip hooray! Quality food, gorgeous atmosphere & great service!!! This is the best Mexican dining experience in the valley!! We shared the 5 Taco Platter and savored all the varied yumminess. This is the BEST GUACAMOLE with tiny bits of orange segment plus a sophisticated spice blend. Happy hour rocks!!! I predict that 2018 is the year for great times at Ladera Taverna y Cocina! Trust me nothing else compares, and we've been searching Phoenix Metro for 14 years.

MccEkFpGiGlnWtso-ZAotw.text: This restaurant is something special! I've been here twice and my goal is to try something different everytime me and my girlfriend come. They gave the best Guacamole I've ever had in my life. And there tacos and desserts arento die for. Customer service here is always wonderful, and the one we is extremely nice and obviously invests into buying njce things for the atmosphere here

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m0zLhs6Xno79RcO3K3ShGA.text: We found a gem on Central! Amazing guacamole, beautiful ambiance, and overall one of our NEW favorite restaurants! A must try!

zS1fd7hWVxIZRMYjLk9lhw.text: The ambience is perfect, both inside and out. We were seated next to the bar, and the night lighting inside isn't too dim, and not bright at all; sexy and romantic.   The mole sauce was on point, just wish they added a side of veggies of some sort instead of black beans and rice.   The Relleno my girlfriend got was also delicious and spicy. Very clean dish (vegetarian).   The cocktails were very tasty (lots of mescal drinks, and allot of mescal brands to choose from). The michelada I got was decent.   Definitely would come here again to try different dishes and cocktails. Perfect place for date night.

ivQ4vl6MAWFdPzmTu4GNMQ.text: We waited 45 minutes for a party of 5. We sat at a table (for drinks only?) on the patio. Not once were we offered a drink. A large party of about 6-8 couples let their children run around in the game area throwing bean bags at each other. Then they took cushions of the patio furniture and had pillow fights with each other. Meanwhile the guy playing guitar and singing put up with these kids running close to his equipment. When we complained to the hostess she told a man who said to the kids "I don't know about the pillow throwing guys". It was a playground and the parents ignored their kids. We saw a table of 2 next to the kids that got up and left before their order was taken.   Our server was attentive and very nice, the drinks were good, the food amazing. But because of the running screaming kids I will give only 1 star. It really ruined the ambience. Manager really should have put a stop to it.

3rcDd59UzQ6xm-iKNlG8iQ.text: Came here for the first time last evening and had a wonderful experience. Was with a group of four and everything everyone ordered was absolutely delicious. The customer service here is also stellar! Would highly recommend for a date night as well as it has a very lovely, intimate ambiance. Will be back again!

tQeQcXIl4wVVAQtZlkeNUg.text: First time going on Saturday, Food and service was amazing, the carne asada tacos had great flavor and the salsa each had there own unique kick, definitely going again.

ZLRw7sB0tmdUpLZXWF8Jsw.text: We ate here last night and we were fairly disappointed. The food is expensive for Mexican food but we knew that going in and had heard good things about the restaurant.  The first thing we found out is they "charge" you for chips and salsa!? This is the first of hundreds of Mexican food restaurants that I have eaten at that charge for chips and salsa. With the high prices of the food you would think you would at least get chips and salsa for free.  In regards to our food it was just decent but nothing spectacular. We ordered the chicken burrito and nacho's. My burrito was a very large portion size and decent. The nachos however were very soggy and had a large piece of fat mixed into it, disappointing. We did get an order of the churro's and they were amazing, some of the best ever.  Lastly, the service wasn't great. We asked for more water over and over, it took 10 minutes in between to get the water jug filled. Even asking for the simplest of things like a straw were difficult for our waitress. The management and hostess staff were very friendly, though. I wish the wait staff took a page from them.

dBZYKo_emAyVfbXQTHCrOg.text: Our first time here! Delicious salsa & guacamole! The 5 taco platter.... my husband really enjoyed! I always like to start with positive! I on the other hand had a quesadilla and added Barbacoa which was way overly salted! I took them to go but accidentally forgot and  didn't go back, which resonates  how salty they were. The service Tony gave though and the music will bring us back just maybe not to order barbacoa!

0EhyrFsmw3OA62rt-b_OrQ.text: We have been here for both brunch and dinner. The brunch menu is fantastic and well priced. Flavors are amazing! I grew up eating traditional Barbacoa when I visited family in South Texas, and this is probably the closest to that taste I have found in the state of Arizona. So good!  For dinner, we came with our entire family, 15 of us. We showed up early for Happy Hour and it did not disappoint. Drinks are great as are their agua frescas. They got everyone's order right and everything went on seamlessly. Definitely adding Ladera to our rotation. The patio is amazing and so nice to sit at!

tXJV7Q9K4P8pTvjKyor4rA.text: Very cute place with a wonderful patio. Excellent service and nice selection of drinks!

mJWIiryDD3qRb3JIHmxljw.text: This was an amazing experience. From the food to the staff to the drinks everything was great. Had a chance to speak to the general manager. I don't comment very frequently on Yelp, however this establishment warranted multiple five stars. We had the carne asada as well as the chili relleno. Both platters were top-notch. They have an amazing happy hour as well as cocktails to Dazzle a pallet.  Definitely need to stop by as you've never been here!

YZZhi2wEZQncni8-FZGHAQ.text: If you are looking to celebrate an occasion this is the place to have it. We decided to have a small party for my 40th birthday. Even though it was only 25 people, the manager Nicole treated us as VIP. The waitress assigned to our group was excellent. I only wished I could remember her name. It was a hot day but they did everything to make it as pleasant as possible. The food was excellent and the back patio was lovely. Thank you so much for making my birthday wonderful!

UETBqOXmRv1Yqz3RnB9VZA.text: A few weeks ago, my friend was visiting from Los Angeles and invited my husband and I for brunch at Ladera. I never even knew it existed and it's now one of my favorite places in the valley!  The location is at the north end of Central. It's charming and unassuming. Its patio is very inviting and there is a guitarist that plays on the weekends during brunch.  We shared the guacamole appetizer with chips. Typical go-to right? Well it's got some zest with Serrano peppers and citrus with oranges, topped with cotija cheese, charred onions and pepitas.  I had the huevos rancheros with fried fresh tortillas mixed with fried beans and ranchero queso fresco cheese sauce, hominy rice, and cilantro. It was topped with over easy eggs. It was very filling and flavorful!  I had a little food envy with my hubby ordering the steak ranchero plate, which included top sirloin, poblanos, potatoes and over easy eggs served with tortillas and rice and beans. That plate was also very filling and not for the faint of heart.   Let me just say that their caramel (or whatever sweetness was!) stuffed churros were amazing!! You must order them. That's not a request!!   The sangrias, bloody marys, and cocktails are wonderful as well. We tried to fit in as much as we could during brunch (wink, wink). We had to stay hydrated with all of our brunching.   I like how this place isn't as snooty and presumptuous like a lot of places are in old Scottsdale. It's very welcoming, inviting, and so stylish in its own right. That's the beauty of being located near the end of Central Avenue.

ea4fessJ8QDvMple6_6HiA.text: I went here for brunch with a friend and I can't believe I never knew this place was here! I'm such a bruncho and this is so close to my neighbourhood!! They have such a gorgeous patio that is partially covered and has a cool atmosphere. The drinks are cheap and tasty. My friend had the mimosa, which she loved-more booze than oj-perfection. I had the bloody and it was spicy! Spicy good though, I love when places aren't afraid of a little heat.   To eat, we split the chilaquielas. The chips are super crispy and don't wilt quickly. The sauce and meat was delicious, just enough heat and just enough creaminess to cut it. I will definitely be back, I can't wait to try the other dishes!!

L6ButBncew37v7GfVbTcIw.text: We stopped in last night for the first time and loved it! Grabbed a table on the patio next to the fireplace - a perfect spot for a date night. Plenty of space indoors or out and a large bar to boot.   Service was great - quick and attentive. Drinks arrived to our table fast and with a smile. My wife had the prickly pear cider (awesome) and I got the house red. Dinner arrived and looked fantastic! I ordered the Carne Asada and my wife, the barbacoa plate. The asada was grilled to perfection, nice sear on the outside and pink in the middle, side of mex corn on the cob, beans, guac were all on point. The barbacoa was tender and had a rich flavor with plenty of sauce. We even got a churro stuffed with dolce de leche to top off the meal.   Overall -the food was dynamite. Street parking was only issue - but who cares? We will be back with the family for round two!

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kIMVLOSk21vxUcbQLzUPdQ.text: This is my new favorite spot and I am in love with this place. It is located where Corbin's used to be (which was one of my favorite breakfast places) but the place has been completely remodeled and has a huge backyard style patio. The patio is fantastic with a lot of space and feels very comfortable.   We arrived on a Sunday during Happy Hour. The place didn't seem too busy and we sat on the patio. Our waiter was super friendly, helpful, and quick. He helped describe some menu items, offer advice on the drinks, and was really great.   After browsing the menu, we decided on getting the guacamole/salsa appetizer and the elote. The guac and salsa were really good. Both were slightly spicy and everyone enjoyed them. The elote was what my husband was craving and he really enjoyed it. Both my sister-in-law and I liked it as well.  I ordered the carne asada and el pastor tacos to try. The carne asada were the winners. My sister-in-law also ordered the carne asada and agreed. The el pastor were flavorful but the meat was super fatty and not great. I expected more from the el pastor but the carne asada made up for it and I will definitely order those again.  My husband ordered the fish tacos - two grilled and one deep fried. The deep fried were juicier and more moist than the grilled, but the grilled had a lot more flavor. Thus it's a toss up. He said he would order them again and they were both good.  To drink, I ordered the paloma and my husband ordered the mezcolada. These were the two drinks I wanted to try and I had a hard time deciding between the two. The paloma was good - it was refreshing and well made. However, the mezcolda was amazing. It was super smokey with a hint of sweet. I would order this again and highly recommend it.  Since we checked in on Yelp, we received a free order of the churros. These were really good. They had a dulce de leche/caramel filling and came with a whipped cream/chocolate sauce. I personally don't think they needed the dipping sauce since they were already so sweet with the filling. However, everyone enjoyed them.  Overall, I would highly recommend this place. I know we will be back every chance we get!

jfD12xHYDzD28Oi3dntPSw.text: We are here tonight with our dear friends.  I think the food deserves a 3.5 and the service a 5 so I'm giving 4.   We ordered the queso flameado which was tasty but flameado to me is stringy cheese that you eat in a tortilla. This was a small dish of queso with chips for $9. Kinda a rip off.   Entrees: seafood enchiladas, carne asada, barbacoa, chile relleno, bean burrito, cheese quesadilla, and posole.   The barbacoa was tasty but I didn't like the stringy pieces of meat. The carne asasa was not seasoned for me. It was on the bland side.   The kids meals were cheese quesadillas and a bean and cheese burrito. They were humongous and expensive.  Please consider making a smaller portion for kids that doesn't cost the same as an adult meal. (See receipt photo).   The service was wonderful and there is a Yelp checkin offer for free churros.

The oranges were not blood oranges, they were very dry, no taste orange segments, the marcona almonds were not marcona,  just a few spiced, canned small almond bits sprinkled on ,  the 6 shrimp were cold cocktail shrimp and the lettuce was not at all fresh, probably several days old. I ate about one fifth of it and couldn't do any more. My husband ordered the breakfast burrito with chorizo.  He only ate about one third as the flavors were not good...poor quality chorizo?  Served with a little shredded lettuce on the side and chopped tomatoes with a bad tasting sauce on the tomatoes.  The portions were big...we would rather have quality over quantity. Will not return.

8x_3k2XF_95UQGUkxcwTDQ.text: Big disappointment at this restaurant.  First walking up to the restaurant I noticed the cooks horsing around and smoking in the little fenced in area near the entrance, should have taken a hint and left then.  But instead walked in and checked in with the host.  Told it would be a fifteen minute wait, no worries went to the bar.  25 minutes go by and no table but noticed plenty of empty seats.  Asked the bar tender to check on our table and turned out the host forgot about us.  Went to the table ordered guacamole and chips.  Chips were not good and the refrigerated, bland, and cold guacamole was not good either.  Salsa was the same, refrigerator temp and bland.  Fish tacos and carne asada tacos for dinner.  Fish tacos were awful, rice was bland and white and not Mexican rice.  Carne asada had good meat, but was not ranchero, was more like cubes cut from a steak.  This place has an identity problem and clearly not authentic Mexican food.  Would not return, complete waste of money.

x5aBu6mnPRdUv3LX5P6-_g.text: I love the food at this restaurant and that is the reason for the 5-star rating.  The other stuff is fine - ambiance, nice patio, service, etc.  But the food, in my opinion, is just spectacular.  We have been here a few times and I feel that I have enough experience to review.  Each time the food has been so tasty.  Most recently, we went for an early dinner during Restaurant Week.  My companions had the prix-fix menu and they loved it.  In particular, the tortilla soup is really good - lots of chicken in it and just the right amount of spice.  I ordered street tacos off the happy hour menu and they were delicious.  The corn appetizer is unique and delicious, too.  There are so many restaurants with great food and we go to many of them.  The food at this restaurant seems to me to be a bit above the others.  I highly recommend it.

GL1B_is4fHpQZRPTgilUYw.text: My fiance took me to Ladera the other night for my birthday, and I love this restaurant! We made it in time for happy hour (Mon-Fri, 3-6p) and were able to get so much food for a great price! :)   For appetizers we got the Guacamole and Queso Fundido, both were so good! The guacamole is interesting because it has pepitas and oranges - which is actually really good. I especially loved the cojita cheese on top, and you get a ton! The queso was amazing, too. Whatever cheese they use is delicious!  My fiance also had a couple of the Margarita En La Casas which he thought were really good, and strong.  Next we ordered one of each taco on the happy hour menu: Pork Pastor, Carne Asada, and Pollo Asado. These were all good! The Pollo Asado is good if you like a lot of toppings, and the Carne Asada is better for someone like my fiance who likes just the basics on a taco.   Next was my favorite part of the whole meal, the dessert! We got an order of the churros (free when you check in on Yelp! :)) and they were to die for lol. Probably the best churros I've ever had. Beware though the filling is hot af and my mouth still hurts two days later haha.   The atmosphere and service at Ladera is great as well! Can't wait to go back sometime, I can guarantee we will just for churros!

Upon arrival we were met by a young lady (who in our opinion looked all of 14 years old and had the attitude of a 14 year old to match).  Inside the restaurant less than 20% of the tables were in use and the young woman told us the only seating available was on the patio outside.  It was still over a hundred degrees outside and my wife asked if we could sit inside at the empty tables and the young woman snapped back those are not available.  Not polite, not customer oriented.  We will never come back.

zezIMADgfn5iBO4R8HtfVg.text: GREAT happy hour! Select $5 cocktails and discounted apps. Love what they did to the building and how they expanded and integrated the outdoor space. And I'm super happy about the parking lot, which is well lit and easily walkable. (I HATE forced valet and I'm so glad they didn't take that route!)  Here's what I thought about the items we had on our happy hour: ~ trio of salsas ($5) all were heavy on the lime; we liked the variety and the chips ~ elote ($5) seemed equivalent to 1 ear of corn, cut into thirds, which help with sharing. The aoli was more apparent than the cojita -- messy but good flavor. ~ green chile pork  ($7) delicious - not enough tortillas! It was very soupy so it was hard to stretch the tortillas by packing them with the chile. Fortunately, the chips from the salsa trio were able to get the job done!  ~ carnitas tacos ($7) the shredded pork melted in your mouth! Great flavor!  ~ carne asada tacos ($7) excellent quality steak, still pink, super tender! A personal favorite! ~ El Santo ($5): think margarita meets a whiskey sour. Would definitely get this again!   We didn't get the nachos but I'm already planning my return -- they looked great!  The cocktail menu had a lot of drinks on it that would make a good nightcap.   The guys did it again with this upscale neighborhood tavern! So grateful to have them in the neighborhood!!

NK9Y24BHAtd6hOh__cIwOQ.text: I keep fluctuating between 3-4 stars... The decor of this restaurant is stunning and in keeping with the Spanish theme. Outdoor patio with romantic lighting, and the inside is just as cozy.  The staff is friendly and the bartenders do a great job.  I was excited to get the margarita with a full paleta inside, but was disheartened to find out they use the store bought Outshine popsicles you can get at the grocery store. They should definitely partner with a local Paleta maker like Paletas Betty. They should be able to find a good vendor, even if it's the Mexican brands found at Food City.  The elote was dry and not seasonal, but the toppings that made it elote were absolutely delicious!   The Cochinita Pibil and Barbacoa were outstanding and well seasoned. The tortillas were definitely not house-made which is a huge bummer, especially in Phoenix.

The staff is super friendly and upbeat and the food was fabulous!! It's a little pricey but honestly in the long run it's well worth it!!   The cocktail list is AWESOME and you can tell the bar manager put some love into it! Another aspect of this place that didn't disappoint was the salsa tray! VFDrauDA4VrFh_CyPkRvdw.text: Wexican Food.  Came by after a funeral with a group of 7.  The ambiance was cool.  Great patio and decor.  Fresh made chips, good salsas, and guac were all pretty solid.  The Santos drink was money but they fit every single bit of ice they could in the short glass.  Maybe got 4 or 5 sips out of it and it was gone.  The tacos were bunk.  Rotisserie chicken tacos (bleh) and flank steak carne asada will never substitute for the real thing.  C'mon people we are in freakin Sunnyslope there are carnicerias on every other corner. Step up your game!  The elote was also whack.  Lacked flavor and was very plain.  The michelada was alright.  It started really good but went down hill after I added more Tecate to it.  The service was bad.  For some reason our waitress was not feeling us.  I'm not sure why.  She was the only one on the patio and from what I could tell was friendly with the other guests.  From the jump she didn't seem to like us.  We had to ask for chips three times.  Took forever to ask us for our drinks.  Not friendly or kind.  Luckily for her I wasn't in charge of the tipping.  Would never come back and never recommend.  Way too many places near here that put out amazing food with a smile.

eXWPPHxXYixUjr-5ZrIafg.text: Great decor. Tasty margaritas nice happy hour I will have dinner next time so that I can review a meal.

RROL0H33PJ9m7UUJZT99jg.text: Good Mexican food in AZ is a dime a dozen. But, one that has good food, good atmosphere and good service, checks enough boxes for me to give them 5 stars. I usually sit at the bar and the service is always great. My wife and I even got an entire lesson on Tequila, of which they have many. It was like going to a wine tasting but with Tequila! The patio is nice and relaxing with a roaring fire and you can even throw bags!!! The only dings I can come up with is that the cafe lights over the area where you throw bags makes it hard to play, and they charge for salsa. But, who goes to a Mexican place to throw bags, and the salsa is actually worth the charge.   Start with a tour of their tacos. Pastor is my favorite. The machaca enchiladas are also amazing.   All in all...it's a great place to pop in for some tacos and beer, or a nice relaxing evening of sipping tequila. The area is really coming into its own.

pxaslODkTP_Fq25xJn7wUg.text: Been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and never had a bad meal! Outdoor patio is the best place to hang out with a group of friends on a nice night. The inside is also very accommodating with a reservation.

Mgwh2M8Dbh7lNPe7B6AAhw.text: We've been wanting to try Ladera for a while. We love the Vig - one of their sister restaurants and we had a gift certificate so two great excuses to go out. The decor and ambiance is 5 stars all the way. We made a 5:30 reservation and they were totally cool when I texted them and asked to move it to 6:00. We sat outside beside the fireplace.  Our server was a bit confused about the IPA options when my husband asked - he said they had three but then couldn't remember what they were. He brought one to the table and then my husband noticed that there were other options not even mentioned. I had a cocktail which was very nice.  For an appetizer we ordered green chile with chips. The chips were housemade and tasty but the green chile was super watery with big chunks of potato in it. I'm sure some people like this but it's not my style. My husband ordered the taco platter and I ordered the chile relleno based on our servers recommendation. And then... we waited. After being seated at 6, it was about 7:20 when our food was actually delivered. The server kept coming back and saying, "what? your food isn't here?". I know they were busy but there was not a lot of accountability there. When we did get our meal, we had two distinct experiences. My husband's tacos were cold having sat for a long time before they were delivered but my relleno was top notch - very good. The manager was alerted to the fact that we'd waited almost an hour and a half to eat and he was genuinedly apologetic and removed our food from the bill - a class act. I would like to say that I will give Ladera another try but the reality is that there are so many fantastic restaurants in Phoenix now, that it may be a long time before I make it back.

-h72xvXJj-sAyucnz-h4bQ.text: This place is awesome! Great food! Great service! Amazing kids menu and bomb churros!

KaeuQ9s1oOPOYC0nE9CQ0A.text: The elotes alone is a great reason to try this place. Their patio is fantastic. The barbacoa was delicious!

tFsRvGr4BurHJrKHpKuYig.text: Such a gem of a restaurant. We love the food, the atmosphere, the drinks, and service. The portions are substantial enough to take it home and have one or two more meals out of it. The cochinita pibil plate is my favorite and is delicious and filling. Served in a banana leaf with a side of black beans and cornbread, I have a hard time NOT ordering it.   The patio space is beautiful with heaters for the "cold" months and room for large groups.

fIdfT2QDM03gjUcaf7s5Ew.text: Exceptional, distinctive Mexican creations here since this place replaced Corbin's.  The al pastor pork tacos were delectable and rich with a medley of tasty ingredients.  The trio de salsas showed off their very distinctive and delicious house and chile de arbol salsa suite.  And their flight of mezcals and tequilas offered an enticing taste of what their extensive menu of agave spirits contains.  Lovely setting with a shaded courtyard off north Central.  Knowledgeable and attentive bartenders.  Also came here for Sunday brunch, and the barbacoa was magnificent.  Also, $4 mimosas and Bloody Marys.

KNbW-Db8hcEk507Iu8_YZQ.text: I love sitting on the patio!  Even on a hot day, they have fans and misters.    The wait staff has always been very friendly.  We also have not had trouble getting a table.  The food is excellent. I usually get tacos and if you want to make them healthier, you can ask for them in lettuce instead of tortillas. Still really good!   Their tortilla chips are made daily! Yummy!  The patio is pretty spacious and we have brought our baby here at least 3 times with no problem!

P5bLpQ-thzSQ6n6_wECUjA.text: No need for passport to travel to Mexico for some great food!!!!! A modern twist on Mexican food right in Phoenix.  There was a mix-up with our reservation and the manager was apologetics and offered us a round of free drinks.  Appetizers and main dishes were prepared with care, perfectly seasoned and beautiful presentation. Home made tortillas hot and fresh, nice margaritas. The roasted corn is to die for so is everything else. I am puzzled by the negative reviews at this place. If you are in Phoenix and want some great food this is the place, reservations are a must in the weekends.

RsOc4Kl0Na52vBrF1GraTw.text: Ok folks here we go, on the menu guac, salsa, chille relleno, steak burrito, chicken burrito,  tacos of pork ALL of it is amazingly delicious! Margarita is made from scratch wtf...so good folks this place is a must try

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guac and salsa

nzVmy7G78PHm75iAPjxlCg.text: What a great find for brunch! It's a cute restaurant, the waiters were attentive and friendly. They have $4 drink specials for brunch and their food was delicious! Let's start with the chips, crispy and not too greasy or salty. The salsas were also very good, we tried 4 different kinds- the house salsa and then an order of the separate salsa on the menu. The house salsa is really good on its own, you don't even need to splurge on the other salsa; unless you love chips and salsa like we do, then it's a must! The guac was also good. For the entree, I got the breakfast burrito with chorizo and WOW! It was a large portion size, after pigging out on chips I could've split an entree with someone, but it was so good. Warm, flavorful and anything you could want with a breakfast burrito! We also got the $4 mimosas, because brunch! We asked her to do just a splash of OJ, and she made them perfectly. Finally, we redeemed our check in offer for the churros, and those were delicious too! Do yourself a favor and come dine here. I definitely want to come back and try dinner.

fi2IHy-Rn_INUXzuikEERg.text: 6 stars. I got the enchilaDAMN they were good. I also got the mimoSO TASTY. I requested a splash of OJ and it was perfect. Lastly, get the cOOOOOOMGOOOOOOrn!

Rk1X95RuhLJjk1Nq4YLUfg.text: You guys! I normally don't want to give more than 5 stars, but this place totally deserves it. I came here for a Yelp event for the first time and was super impressed with the bartender and staff. So I came back for a second round with a friend and  still feel the same. The bartender "Alex" was awesome and took great care of us. Not only that he is super personable. I don't normally frequent places, but I will definitely be back here, with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guac and chips

D83XviVpkF6lfPT4NqA-gg.text: Great venue, friendly service and very efficient even with a group of 11. Food was delicious, good drink specials for brunch and fabulous live music. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria Blanco
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa Hash &amp; Street corn

IA_hKa1JwKOn8DZjxrdvng.text: Came here for dinner.  We explored the whole menu and there was some good and some bad.    First, I wish it hadn't been so hot because sitting outside is definitely better than inside in terms of decor/vibe/ambience.  The inside was nice, but outside is better.   Second, service was excellent and food came out fast.     Now for the food.  Started with the 3 salsas and the roasted corn (chose off the cob). Chips were good and addictive (as expected), but none of the salsas was special.  I would pass. The corn was good, but should have been served hot.  It was lukewarm. Also could have used a bit more salt.    Next we went for the ceviche.  All of the elements on this were very good, but it felt like it was missing something.  The white fish was excellent in this.    Then we turned to the tacos: pastor and the other pork, fish (crispy and not), and cactus.  Best of the bunch were the pastor and the crispy fish tacos.    We're stuffed at this point, but waitress recommended the enchiladas with the crab meat.  I'm glad we got this because the enchiladas were delicious.  If you like crab, the you should definitely get this.   We ended with coffee and the churros (churros courtesy of the yelp check in).  Coffee was notably delicious and those churros were outstanding with hot caramel inside and a yummy whipped cream to dip into.    We also ordered the OG and the Cadillac marg.  They were a bit strong to start, but mellowed out.  Not good enough to get us to order a second round unfortunately.    I'd come back, but would focus on the highlights and try a couple new items.

wBCqh7up5gWosNvrJSu1_A.text: We were visiting Phoenix from the Pacific Northwest and were on a hunt for upscale Mexican. This restaurant did not disappoint.   Seating and ambience is intimate. The restaurant has a great outdoor seating area and indoor seating was also worthy, given the large, French doors were wide open.  Service was prompt, not obnoxiously hovering, and very helpful.  We ate ceviche, street corn, and since it was a Tuesday - tacos! (Duh) The ceviche was top notch. It was garnished with jalapenos. That was fine for us, but you may ask to refrain from that if that's too spicy for you. The street corn was creamy and delish. The tacos came as a variety and all were very good (short ribs, roasted chicken, fried fish, not fried fish, skirt steak, etc).  Our check-in on Yelp got us a free order of churros, which were great. Filled with dulce de leche and swimming in sugar, with a ramekin of chocolate and cream.  I drank a house margarita and it was well made.  Great restaurant! I wish we had one in Oregon. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo Asado Tacos
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros!
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche and street corn

yA6wJo5eLC_Dg7ig2U8RlA.text: First time here.  No waiting but decided to sit at the bar anyway.    ALEX, our bartender is one of the best I've ever had the privilege of meeting.  He gave us suggestions that were with their weight in gold.  The margaritas were perfect!  We ordered the taco platter off the taco Tuesday menu and scored a few bucks off.    Checking in on Yelp will get you a free order if churros too.     We WILL be back.     Thanks ALEX for the great dining/bar experience!!

i1aeag74xfHyR-QANvFPJA.text: I've enjoyed every visit to Ladera. The servers are always welcoming and have recommendations for any craving you might have.   Pros: -Outdoor patio is superb for dining in the spring -House margarita with tajin instead of salt rim is where it's at  -Frozen sangria for those with a sweet tooth -Street corn all day! -Ceviche is has the perfect pairing of sweetness and spice. The pomegranate and jalapeno slices make this appetizer -The tortilla that envelops the bean and cheese is pure perfection

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House margarita with tajin...!

13boP7kjYtwDdhhBzIZYvQ.text: Food is fantastic but the bartender is more interested in tending to the reps with alcohol rather than his customers.  Waited forever to get my drink.

Dv7tpSPX_LoY0RpmYQZPqw.text: I just wasnt over the moon about it.   The drink was good.   Food lack luster , it hit at a C. The serving size was ok.. but it kinda just stopped there. The rice had no flavor. Was literally bland and white in color. Sprinkled some cilantro over it..   Tacos were ok, but at the price point of 14 dollars, I think it's about 4 dollars over price wise. My reasoning is - IMO the tacos were about 2 dollars good. ( size and taste considered) possibly 3. The rice was an oversight and just really had no place on the plate being it was bland. So ..  For the price.. it just isnt worth returning. IMO

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZTm9MM04c_RdGd0Fene2Ow.text: This is one of our new favorite Mexican places! The vibe and decor is soooo cute, I just hope it gets busy so it doesn't go out of business. We can on a weekend evening and there was only one other couple there.  The patio is beautiful and that's where we chose to sit. It was a tad bit warm but they have fans which helped. It's also located right off the central but you can't hear much traffic which is nice.   We got the chips, salsa and guac to start. The portions were large and the guac was cold and tasted fresh. They had happy hour and our server was awesome and gave me veggie tacos for happy hour pricing. These were the best veggie tacos I have ever had, and large- I could not finish them! So many veggies. My boyfriend got the chicken tacos and he really enjoyed them as well. I got the strawberry margarita which was pretty strong, but delicious. They used fresh strawberries. My boyfriend got the house margarita which he also enjoyed. The churro/ice cream dessert was out of this world. The ice cream was fried and with the cinnamon and sugar churros, oh man! Prepare to be impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros!
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie tacos
Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa and guac

JkzX8UCmJYeZtebKB-LTHg.text: First time visiting Phoenix and I was so ready to find a place that sold tacos and margaritas! And guess what- I did!! First off - I didn't know they had a taco Tuesday deal. You get 5 tacos and a margarita for $15!!  For me, that's kind of a big deal because I'm not use to that type of stuff in Cincinnati.  It was also my bday as well so they gave me a free shot and some churros!! The atmosphere was amazing and the outside area is so nice. They have a lounge like area with a fire pit and flowers/plants all around. So pretty!  Now the good part- the tacos are so awesome!! I got the shrimp and fish tacos and the meat was tender and they had great flavor. Unfortunately- I didn't take a picture because I was so juicy I ate them before I could even remember to take the pic ..... so my apologies about that!!  The staff was so nice and friendly. Overall, amazing place and you should definitely try it out!!

UaBDraG3Y3l6tA8SfccrAQ.text: This is seriously one of the best spots on Central Ave! Whatever you want - brunch, lunch, happy hour, a great dinner, Ladera delivers. They have amazing drink specials on brunch and happy hour, and the huge patio is the perfect place to relax and enjoy your meal! Their food is always amazing and I seriously want to try everything on their menu. Gotta come check out Ladera if you haven't yet!

Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

0_GIr2fcLkzZicGJ87phjw.text: What a beautiful space with a lovely courtyard - perfect for dining during the pleasant Arizona months! They do a great job serving up elevated Latin fare in a modernized setting (that still boast beautiful cultural flair).  We took some of our family members here (including one three-year-old) and everyone enjoyed their food as well as the ambiance. Unfortunately it was too hot to sit outdoors on our visit, so we enjoyed the dining area.  Husband and MIL had seafood enchiladas - plentiful portions and both said they would order them again. Husband has a seasoned palate when it comes to seafood enchiladas so I didn't take that review lightly. I will order them next time!  Street tacos were small, but mighty in taste and were loaded with the chosen protein/veggies. With the sides, three tacos are plenty for one person. Barbacoa was moist and tender and more savory than sweet (which I prefer) - definitely enough for 2! Craft drinks were delicious and I was pleased so see their own spin on the ingredient compositions.  Don't miss this place!

2yIJ9PL86M2VByH03QJ8fA.text: Shortly after this experience Nicole, the GM reached out to me to discuss the service issue that I encountered.  Very impressed at the True concern that she had with the service. There were certainly some factors that I was unaware of that led to the poor service. In any event we decided to give it a try again last night. No surprise, the food was fantastic. Absolutely everything we had was superb. The service too was fantastic. A well oiled machine last night. Even through the crowd Nicole had a chance to stop by and chat. Super nice person. Great food. Great service.  Thank you Nicole.  Your restaurant will be a regular stop for us.   Ok. Second time here. Food is really good. Service is the worst ever. Unfortunately I had the same waitress both times. Forgot drinks BOTH times. Appetizers came with my meal.   Both times it took 15 minutes to get my drinks. Both times I got my drinks only because I went to get them.   My God. What nonsense

dHyttBEX-ggUBJcDdpwm5Q.text: Tara our server was great !! We had a lot of questions and she was so patient and informative. Food was really good. I could use some more spice but the flavors were great . We had the guacamole, corn, french toast, caesar salad and steak ranchera. the french toast was sweet but delicious. and don't forget the churros!  they have $4 mimosas and good sangria. the ambiance was fantastic and service from the entire staff was excellent.

NuHn5hWhcZ2kJo8L_1Af_w.text: Such a great hidden gem! It's right by our house and is absolutely some of the best Mexican food we've eaten. Very authentic. The place and ambience are great.   And my gluten free boyfriend can eat here without any worry or issues!!! Come and check it out, there's rarely wait.

_ZTA5jFtfLtzhj-nPCF_Pw.text: Ladera is located just South of Central and Dunlap in Phoenix, parking is odd in the sense you need to self-park a bit down the street a lot over from the restaurant.  Restaurant very clean and a modern take on the Latin vibe.  My girlfriend and I went for Happy Hour to try out a new place and was pleasantly surprised, as we all know I am bit of a Mexican good snob.  We tried to Guacamole which was refreshing and delightful, the corn aka Elote was amazing.  We also split a taco plate I liked the Carne Taco as it wasnt over seasoned as some locations try to do.   Side note; be cautious when outside on the patio on this day it was a bit windy and an umbrella feel over on to our table, the restaurant did bring us out new dishes and drinks no harm no foul.

jbtYGOHdBg9w9NTvbDDzsg.text: Yummy!!! This place was great. It is very upscale Mexican food so if you want everything covered in cheese and deep fried, this is the wrong place! We ordered the margarita, chips and salsa trio, elote, barbacoa, cochina pibil, and free churros for checking in!   Margarita- so good! Not super sweet, enough tequila, only $5 for happy hour.  Chips and salsa- chips were good, nothing amazing. The salsa was realllly spicy. Almost too spicy for us to even eat. The red salsa was the best one!   Elote- omg so great. I love elote and this was the best I've ever had.  Barbacoa- huge portion of delicious meat served with corn tortillas. The barbacoa was so tender, juicy, and flavorful.   Cochina pibil- same thing as the barbacoa- served the same way and equally delicious though I think I liked the barbacoa a little more.   Churros- mmmmm!! They were filled with caramel or something and came with this super fluffy chocolatey whipped cream. Really good! I would definitely order these again.   The waitress was great and the manager came by a few times to make sure we had what we needed. The atmosphere was really nice. I can't wait until it's cooler so we can enjoy their adorable patio!

YkEjsN33FjK3lw-V60GBsQ.text: This place never disappoints.  This isn't your regular Mexican food restaurant. It's higher quality, healthier and full of flavor.  The chips, salsa and guacamole are delicious. The brunch is wonderful. The bartenders and servers are always so friendly.  And you can even enjoy the beautiful outdoor patio on hot days. It's got a great decor and on the weekends there's live music.

CLqGAPfdPqiyh-hs9LeCWQ.text: Gorgeous setting, very good service, and hands down the best 'street tacos' we've had in the valley.  The carne asada tacos were quite good but even better were the crispy fish tacos, and the star of the taco plate was the shrimp.   The carne asada entree was also exceptional, particularly when plated with the elote.  I'd also recommend the guacamole and loved the fact that they continued to refill the salsa roja and chips when requested.   The only disappointment were the frioles de fiesta which were too soupy to eat.  Really a hidden gem in this quiet neighborhood.  If they had a 4 1/2 star option I'd round up!

4Ui9uMgl7gYKipMzp1XXIA.text: My husband and I went yesterday to celebrate our 5th year anniversary. We love this place. Very cosy, great service, clean & the food, drinks, desserts are amazing. Is our third time visiting this restaurant. First time we were passing by and stopped, second time we were celebrating our engagement and this last time celebrating our anniversary.

Photo of Ladera Taverna y Cocina - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja crispy fish tacos and a carne asada taco super good. Waiting on our churros now.

mDF5VsRZcZhUK7pSVl4twQ.text: Excellent food excellent service great atmosphere . The only reason i didn't give it five stars is due to pricing and portions. Slightly overpriced and no complementary chips and salsa.

eM4NcBLjOnxa-3YmLHbYNQ.text: Great food, fun atmosphere, wonderful brunch , Sarah our waitress was super on top of everything!!  Definitely will be back, even the manager Dijon stopped by to see how he food was and introduced himself.  This makes for such an easy choice when we decide for brunch...  we will be back, repeatedly!!!!!!

KggT4-_ckn7wutkwN0az7A.text: We had a really good experience at Ladera for a group of seven. Every single of of the staff (Hostess, Waitress (Haily), Waiting-staff, and General Manager were very friendly and helpful. The drinks were tasty with a twist - nicely done! Food is definitely an A+. Everyone of us were satisfied with our order. Let's talk about ambiance. We were really impressed with it's spacious setting and structural appealing, inside and outside. In particular, the patios has a play-area (like a kids-zone), then a "formal" dining area with a lovely fireplace. We are especially glad to have Ladera in our neighborhood...bringing up the trendiness and new-concept of dining.  We highly recommend this place, and we will come back very soon. Kudos & Happy Dining !

KlUiz09UyGGBh-b9_D466Q.text: As a Mexican American who grew up with the food of my culture, I can confidently say that Ladera has made me feel at home with their amazing dishes. I love the fact that they put new twists on traditional meals but are still able to keep the flavors and passion alive in their cooking. An added bonus is the atmosphere. From the beautiful decor to the helpful waitstaff to the traditional music I am thankful to say that I have found a new weekend place. I cannot wait to bring my family. Salud!

yM6_mGGJ0R8HAON0SThK4g.text: This has to be one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. I know there are so many great restaurants in the area but the service, decor music on a sunny Sunday afternoon was awesome. Miguel was playing great guitar from many genres and the food was excellent.

yfTMrvpGS2RD5kl9cakYYg.text: Love this place. A friend recommended this place and km glad he did. I've only been there for dinner and it's very good. All tacos are delicious, my favorite is the rice. Margaritas are awesome, atmosphere is great especially when I have my two kids, it's very kid friendly, customer service is ok but waitress need to be a bit more attentive! This is my new spot and can't wait to have brunch here because I heard it's also delicious.
